posts.PostData: Wireshark, formerly known as Ethereal, is an indispensable tool for network pentesting and protocol analysis. As an open-source packet analyzer, Wireshark enables security professionals, ethical hackers, and network administrators to capture, inspect, and analyze network traffic in real-time. With its extensive protocol support and user-friendly interface, Wireshark has become a preferred choice for professionals engaged in network penetration testing.

Phishing is a pervasive and cunning cyber attack technique that poses a significant threat to mobile users. It involves deceiving individuals into divulging sensitive information, such as login credentials, financial details, or personal data, by impersonating trustworthy entities. With the increasing reliance on mobile devices for communication, banking, and online transactions, phishing attacks have found a fertile ground in the mobile realm.

SMS Phishing (Smishing): Attackers use text messages to lure recipients into clicking malicious links or disclosing sensitive information through fraudulent messages, often impersonating banks, service providers, or reputable organizations.

App-Based Phishing: Malicious apps impersonating legitimate ones may be distributed on third-party app stores or through links shared via social media and messaging apps. Once installed, these apps can harvest user data or perform unauthorized actions.
